accessibility.title: Progressive enhancement
accessibility.description: Major functionality like main navigation and search should work without JavaScript enabled.

documentation.title: Enable / Disable JavaScript in Chrome Developer Tools

accessibility.title: Color contrast
accessibility.description: Color contrast should at least pass WCAG AA (AAA for mobile).

accessibility.title: H1
accessibility.description: All pages have an H1 which is not the title of the website.

accessibility.title: Headings
accessibility.description: Headings should be used properly in the right order (H1 to H6).

video.title: Why headings and landmarks are so important -- A11ycasts #18

documentation.title: Using ARIA landmarks to identify regions of a page

accessibility.title: Specific HTML5 input types are used
accessibility.description: This is especially important for mobile devices that show customized keypads and widgets for different types.

accessibility.title: Label
accessibility.description: A label is associated with each input form element. In case a label can't be displayed, use aria-label instead.

accessibility.title: Accessibility standards testing
accessibility.description: Use the WAVE tool to test if your page respects the accessibility standards.

accessibility.title: Keyboard navigation
accessibility.description: Test your website using only your keyboard in a previsible order. All interactive elements are reachable and usable.

accessibility.title: Screen-reader
accessibility.description: All pages were tested in a screen-reader (VoiceOver, ChromeVox, NVDA or Lynx).

accessibility.title: Focus style
accessibility.description: If the focus is disabled, it is replaced by visible state in CSS.

css.title: Responsive Web Design
css.description: The website is using responsive web design.

css.title: CSS Print
css.description: A print stylesheet is provided and is correct on each page.

css.title: Unique ID
css.description: If IDs are used, they are unique to a page.

css.title: Reset CSS
css.description: A CSS reset (reset, normalize or reboot) is used and up to date.
css.detail: (If you are using a CSS Framework like Bootstrap or Foundation, a Normalize is already included into it.)

css.title: JS prefix
css.description: All classes (or id- used in JavaScript files) begin with js- and are not styled into the CSS files.

css.title: Embedded or inline CSS
css.description: Avoid at all cost embeding CSS in <style> tags or using inline CSS
css.detail: Only use for valid reasons (e.g. background-image for slider, critical CSS).

css.title: Vendor prefixes
css.description: CSS vendor prefixes are used and are generated accordingly with your browser support compatibility.

css.title: Concatenation
css.description: CSS files are concatenated in a single file (Not for HTTP/2).

css.title: Non-blocking
css.description: CSS files need to be non-blocking to prevent the DOM from taking time to load.

documentation.title: Example of preload CSS using loadCSS

css.title: Stylelint
css.description: All CSS or SCSS files are without any errors.

css.title: Responsive web design
css.description: All pages were tested with the correct breakpoints.
css.detail: Example of breakpoints: 320px, 768px, 1024px (can be more / different according to your analytics)

css.title: CSS Validator
css.description: The CSS was tested and pertinent errors were corrected.

css.title: Desktop Browsers
css.description: All pages were tested on all current desktop browsers (Safari, Firefox, Chrome, Internet Explorer, EDGE...)

css.title: Mobile Browsers
css.description: All pages were tested on all current mobile browsers (Native browser, Chrome, Safari...)

css.title: OS
css.description: All pages were tested on all current OS (Windows, Android, iOS, Mac...)

css.title: Reading direction
css.description: All pages need to be tested for LTR and RTL languages if they need to be supported.

documentation.title: Building RTL-Aware Web Apps & Websites: Part 1 - Mozilla Hacks
Building RTL-Aware Web Apps & Websites: Part 2 - Mozilla Hacks

head.title: Doctype
head.description: The Doctype is HTML5 and is at the top of all your HTML pages.

documentation.title: Determining the character encoding - HTML5 W3C

head.title: Charset
head.description: The charset declared (UTF-8) is declared correctly.

head.title: X-UA-Compatible
head.description: The X-UA-Compatible Meta tag is present.

head.title: Title
head.description: A title is used on all pages
head.detail: SEO: Google calculate the pixel width of the characters used in the title, cut off between 472 and 482 pixels. Average character limit would be around 55-characters

head.title: Description
head.description: A meta description is provided, it is unique and doesn't possess more than 150 characters.

head.title: Favicons
head.description: Each favicon has been created and displays correctly.
head.detail: If you have only a favicon.ico, put it at the root of your site. Normally you won't need to use any markup. However, it's still good practice to link to it using the example below. Today, PNG format is recommended over .ico format (dimensions: 32x32px).

documentation.title: Favicons, Touch Icons, Tile Icons, etc. Which Do You Need? - CSS Tricks

head.title: Apple Touch Icon
head.description: Apple touch favicon apple-mobile-web-app-capable are present
head.detail: Create your Apple Icon file with at least 200x200px dimension to support all dimensions that you may need.

head.title: Windows Tiles
head.description: Windows tiles are present and linked.

head.title: Canonical
head.description: Use rel="canonical" to avoid duplicate content.

documentation.title: Use canonical URLs - Search Console Help - Google Support
5 common mistakes with rel=canonical - Google Webmaster Blog

head.title: Language attribute
head.description: The lang attribute of your website is specified and related to the language of the current page.

head.title: Direction attribute
head.description: The direction of lecture is specified on the html tag (It can be used on another HTML tag).

head.title: Alternate language
head.description: The language tag of your website is specified and related to the language of the current page.

head.title: Conditional comments
head.description: Conditional comments are present for IE if needed.

documentation.title: About conditional comments (Internet Explorer) - MSDN - Microsoft

head.title: RSS feed
head.description: If your project is a blog or has articles, an RSS link was provided.

head.title: Inline critical CSS
head.description: The inline critical CSS is correctly injected in the HEAD.
head.detail: CSS which styles content that is immediately visible during pageload ("above the fold content") is called "critical CSS". It is embedded before your principal CSS call and between <style></style> in a single line (minified).

tools.title: Critical by Addy Osmani on GitHub automates this.

head.title: CSS order
head.description: All CSS files are loaded before any JavaScript files in the HEAD
head.detail: (Except the case where sometimes JS files are loaded asynchronously on top of your page)

head.title: Facebook Open Graph
head.detail: All Facebook Open Graph (OG) are tested and no one is missing or with a false information. Images need to be at least 600 x 315 pixels, 1200 x 630 pixels recommended. Using og:image:width and og:image:height will specify the image dimensions to the crawler so that it can render the image immediately without having to asynchronously download and process it.

documentation.title: A Guide to Sharing for Webmasters

tools.title: Test your page with the Facebook OG testing

documentation.title: Getting started with cards â€” Twitter Developers

tools.title: Test your page with the Twitter card validator

html.title: HTML5 Semantic Elements
html.description: HTML5 Semantic Elements are used appropriately (header, section, footer, main...).

html.title: Error pages
html.detail: Remember that the 5xx error pages need to have their CSS integrated (no external call on the current server).

html.title: Noopener
html.description: In case you are using external links with target="_blank", your link should have a rel="noopener" attribute to prevent tab nabbing. If you need to support older versions of Firefox, use rel="noopener noreferrer"

html.title: Clean up comments
html.description: Unnecessary code needs to be removed before sending the page to production.

html.title: W3C compliant
html.description: All pages need to be tested with the W3C validator to identify possible issues in the HTML code.

html.title: HTML Lint
html.description: I use tools to help me analyze any issues I could have on my HTML code.

tools.title: Sonar a linting tool for the web

html.title: Link checker
html.description: There are no broken links in my page, verify that you don't have any 404 error.

html.title: Adblockers test
html.description: Your website shows your content correctly with adblockers enabled
html.detail: (You can provide a message encouraging people to disable their adblocker)

images.title: Optimization
images.description: All images are optimized to be rendered in the browser. WebP format could be used for critical pages (like Homepage)

tools.title: Use ImageOptim to optimise your images for free.
Use Kraken.io awesome alternative for both png and jpg optimization. Up to 1mb per files on free plan.

images.title: Picture/Srcset
images.description: You use picture/srcset to provide the most appropriate image for the current viewport of the user.

documentation.title: How to Build Responsive Images with srcset

images.title: Retina
images.description: You provide layout images 2x or 3x, support retina display.

images.title: Sprite
images.description: Small images are in a sprite file (in the case of icons, they can be in an SVG sprite image).

images.title: Width and Height
images.description: Set width and height attributes on if the final rendered image size is known (can be omitted for CSS sizing).

images.title: Alternative text
images.description: All have an alternative text which describe the image visually.

images.title: Lazy loading
images.description: Images are lazyloaded (A noscript fallback is always provided).

javascript.title: JavaScript Inline
javascript.description: You don't have any JavaScript code inline (mixed with your HTML code).

javascript.title: Minification
javascript.description: JavaScript files are minified (you can add the .min suffix).

documentation.title: Guidelines for Developing Secure Applications Utilizing JavaScript

javascript.title: Non-blocking
javascript.description: JavaScript files are loaded asynchronously using async or deferred using defer attribute.

javascript.title: Modernizr
javascript.description: If you need to target some specific features you can use a custom Modernizr to add classes in your <html> tag.

javascript.title: ESLint
javascript.description: No errors are flagged by ESLint (based on your configuration or standards rules).

documentation.title: ESLint - The pluggable linting utility for JavaScript and JSX

performance.title: Page weight
performance.description: The weight of each page is between 0 and 500 KB.

documentation.title: Size Limit: Make the Web lighter

performance.title: Lazy loading
performance.description: Images, scripts and CSS need to be lazy loaded to improve the response time of the current page (See details in their respective sections)

performance.title: Cookie size
performance.description: If you are using cookies be sure each cookie doesn't exceed 4096 bytes and your domain name doesn't have more than 20 cookies.

performance.title: Third party components
performance.detail: Third party iframes or components relying on external JS (like sharing buttons) are replaced by static components when possible, thus limiting calls to external APIs and keeping your users activity private.

performance.title: DNS resolution
performance.description: DNS of third-party services that may be needed are resolved in advance during idle time using dns-prefetch.

performance.title: Preconnection
performance.description: DNS lookup, TCP handshake and TLS negotiation with services that will be needed soon is done in advance during idle time using preconnect.

performance.title: Prefetching
performance.description: Resources that will be needed soon (e.g. lazy loaded images) are requested in advance during idle time using prefetch.

performance.title: Preloading
performance.description: Resources needed in the current page (e.g. scripts placed at the end of <body>) in advance using preload.

performance.title: Google PageSpeed
performance.description: All your pages were tested (not only the homepage) and have a score of at least 90/100.

tools.title: Test your mobile speed with Google
WebPagetest - Website Performance and Optimization Test
GTmetrix - Website speed and performance optimization

seo.title: Google Analytics
seo.description: Google Analytics is installed and correctly configured.

seo.title: Headings logic
seo.description: Heading text helps to understand the content in the current page.

seo.title: sitemap.xml
seo.description: A sitemap.xml exists and was submitted to Google Search Console.

seo.title: Structured Data
seo.description: Pages using structured data are tested and are without errors.
seo.detail: Structured data helps crawlers understand the content in the current page.

documentation.title: Introduction to Structured Data - Search - Google Developers

tools.title: Test your page with the Structured Data Testing Tool
Complete list of vocabularies that can be used as structured data. Schema.org Full Heirarchy

seo.title: Sitemap HTML
seo.description: An HTML sitemap is provided and is accessible via a link in the footer of your website.

webfonts.title: Webfont format
webfonts.description: WOFF, WOFF2 and TTF are supported by all modern browsers.

documentation.title: WOFF - Web Open Font Format - Caniuse
WOFF 2.0 - Web Open Font Format - Caniuse
TTF/OTF - TrueType and OpenType font support

webfonts.title: Webfont size
webfonts.description: Webfont sizes don't exceed 2 MB (all variants included).

webfonts.title: Webfont loader
webfonts.description: Control loading behavior with a webfont loader.
